definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: Many taggers merely want to have their name seen.
sentences.chinese: 許多“留名者”只是想讓其名諱被看到而已。

definition: to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to transcribe/to make a fair copy

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
